primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Cosmic Judge (Christ) returns to separate humanity, vindicating the 'least' and those who served them, ultimately swallowing the 'Old Adam' in the victory of Christ's righteousness.

tekstueel_bewijs: he will sit on his glorious throne
he will separate them one from another
the One who will preside over it is the One who was crucified
inherit the kingdom prepared for you
all in Christ shall all be made alive
kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Least', the Church, and the Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one needing mercy/the one surprised by grace).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Church's Witness
tekstueel_bewijs: by his indwelling Spirit he will make us
the church exists... to testify to the truth
the old Adam is right there underneath the surface
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological state ('Old Adam') that requires death and resurrection, not just moral effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of discipleship: serving the 'least' as a fruit of faith.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (in Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly described as an 'unconscious' fruit of the primary program (soteriology).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Kingdom → The Redeemed
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → Jesus Christ ← Sin/Old Adam

the Master who does a lot more than just beckon
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we look both backward and forward
one can never be said to have done one’s share

voorbeelden: what we are intended to feel is... awe

by his indwelling Spirit he will make us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the inability of the human subject (Adam) and the enabling power (Pouvoir) of Christ/Spirit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the negation of skepticism (~S2) to the failure of moralism (~S1), landing on the substitutionary work of Christ (S1 taking the place of S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The 'Judge judged in our place' resolves the tension between human failure and divine holiness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'eternal fire' and 'doomed' state of the self are explicitly mentioned.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God/Christ as the active Subject of salvation and transformation, treating human works as an unconscious byproduct rather than a condition.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: John McCain... recalled to my faith

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Judge judged in our place
There is no human merit anywhere to bail us out.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as models to imitate, but as participants in a cosmic drama.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sheep are surprised by their own actions, emphasizing that the action was Christ in them, not their own imitation.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from the 'Old Adam' to being 'In Christ'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God works in the believer).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the 'already' of the cross and the 'not yet' of the return.
spanning_punten: The transition to the 'Pledge Sunday' feels slightly forced actantially, though theologically grounded in 'gratitude'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: covering our unrighteousness with his righteousness... the Judge judged in our place

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) that the Law merely demands.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric narrative structure. Christ is the Subject of both the judgment and the fulfillment of the law.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The current balance effectively counters the 'Devoir' (Moralism) of the culture.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Old Adam' is a sufficiently heavy opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful homiletical movement that avoids the trap of turning the Sheep/Goats parable into a new law.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the Robert Hughes anecdote, semiotics reveals how Hughes functions as a 'Negative Sender' of values.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the sheep/goats; semiotics shows that the 'surprise' of the sheep is the key to the Subject-Object relationship (Grace).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'Old Adam' is a sub-actant within the hearer that must be defeated by the primary Subject (Christ).

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly critiques moralism, making the semiotic analysis align perfectly with the preacher's stated intent.
